definition: adornment/to adorn/dress/clothing/costume (of an actor in a play)/to play a role/to pretend/to install/to fix/to wrap (sth in a bag)/to load/to pack

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

sentences.english: She can more or less assume his cocksureness.
sentences.chinese: 母鸡可以多多少少地装出公鸡的自信。

sentences.english: She acted out the role of a wronged lover to make him feel guilty.
sentences.chinese: 她装出一副受委屈的情人的样子，以让他感到内疚。

sentences.english: And he pretends to be omniscient.
sentences.chinese: 他还装出一副无所不知的样子。

sentences.english: I pretend to be a human through Linguini.
sentences.chinese: 而在小林面前，我又得装出一副人的模样。

sentences.english: She strikes a pose of being an invalid when really she is well and strong.
sentences.chinese: 她装出一副有病体弱的样子，但实际上身体强壮。

sentences.english: She affected a look of disinterest as she glanced at his newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 当她扫视他的报纸时，她装出一副不感兴趣的表情。

sentences.english: He assumes a well-informed manner but in fact knows very little.
sentences.chinese: 他装出一副博学多闻的样子，其实懂得很少。

sentences.english: But soon he again assumed a confiding tone.
sentences.chinese: 但很快，他又装出一副让人信任的语气来。
他装出一副可怜的样子。

sentences.english: The attendants attend the meeting and  pretend to be attentive.
sentences.chinese: 侍从们出席会议并装出专注的样子。

sentences.english: He raised his eyebrows with an affectation of surprise.
sentences.chinese: 他扬起双眉装出一幅惊奇的样子。

sentences.english: In 2009, China's clothing export once into a two-digit growth.
sentences.chinese: 2009年，我国服装出口一度陷入两位数负增长。

sentences.english: When Harry put on his act of being mildly annoyed, the assistant promised to order some for him.
sentences.chinese: 哈里装出不高兴的样子时，女售货员答应为他定货。

sentences.english: The fashion repairs a background brattishing and embark a proptosis with the hue you of individualism.
sentences.chinese: 时尚装修背景墙，用色彩装出你的个性。

sentences.english: He seems arrogant because he overcompensates for his feeling of inferiority.
sentences.chinese: 他为弥补自己的自卑感而装出傲慢的样子。

sentences.english: You affect this gayety to inspire me with courage.
sentences.chinese: 你是为了鼓励我才装出高兴的样子。

definition: to pretend/to feign/to act a part
to assume/to adopt (a look, pose, manner etc)/to bring out for display
as if nothing had happened (idiom); calmly/nonchalantly
not in the least concerned (idiom)/reckless/couldn't give a damn about it/unperturbed/couldn't care less/harum scarum
to put on an act (idiom); to show affectation/to indulge in histrionics
to pretend to look happy/to force oneself to smile
